# Instagram Carousel: Gonio Fortress

**Generated:** 2025-11-07
**Source Script:** dist/georgia/gonio-fortress/2025-11-04/script.md
**Total Slides:** 10
**Narrative Arc:** Skepticism ‚Üí Physical Discovery ‚Üí Historical Awe ‚Üí Deep Time Perspective

---

## SLIDE-BY-SLIDE CONTENT

### Slide 1: Title/Hook
**Visual:** Most dramatic shot of fortress towers against mountains/sea (preferably golden hour)
**Text Overlay:**
```
"Just Old Stones"

(That's what I thought)
```
**Design Notes:**
- Large, bold font for "Just Old Stones" (70-80pt, white text)
- Subtext in smaller italic font (40pt, slightly transparent)
- Place text in top third to avoid obscuring fortress towers
- Add subtle dark overlay (20-30% opacity) for text readability

**Character Count:** 29 characters

---

### Slide 2: Setup/Expectation
**Visual:** View from marshrutka window or exterior shot showing Soviet apartments behind fortress
**Text Overlay:**
```
40 cents on a marshrutka
$3 to get in

I was skeptical
Super skeptical

Another tourist trap?
```
**Design Notes:**
- Left-align text, bottom third placement
- Use contrasting color (white or cream) against darker overlay
- Keep font simple and readable (60pt headline, 36pt body)

**Character Count:** 78 characters

---

### Slide 3: First Discovery
**Visual:** Massive fortress walls, close-up showing scale of Roman blocks
**Text Overlay:**
```
The stones are nearly
ONE METER THICK

2000 years old
And you can TOUCH them

Most sites rope everything off
Not here
```
**Design Notes:**
- Emphasize "ONE METER THICK" with bold or different color
- Center text or place in clear sky area
- Consider split layout: stat on top, emotion on bottom

**Character Count:** 94 characters

---

### Slide 4: Climbing Experience
**Visual:** Stone staircase inside tower, worn steps visible, or hand touching ancient wall
**Text Overlay:**
```
I'm climbing stairs
worn down by 2000 years
of footsteps

Roman soldiers
Byzantine warriors
Ottoman guards

All climbed these exact stairs
```
**Design Notes:**
- Italicize the empire list for emphasis
- Use line breaks to create rhythm
- Consider warm color palette to emphasize age/warmth of stone

**Character Count:** 125 characters

---

### Slide 5: The View (Emotional Peak Part 1)
**Visual:** Panoramic view from tower top‚ÄîBlack Sea on one side, Caucasus mountains on other
**Text Overlay:**
```
Black Sea stretching forever
Snow-capped mountains rising

And suddenly I understood

Why they built a fortress HERE
```
**Design Notes:**
- Minimal text to let photo do the work
- Place text along horizon line or in sky
- Use understated font to not compete with epic view

**Character Count:** 100 characters

---

### Slide 6: History in Layers

**Text Overlay:**
```
You can SEE history in layers

‚¨á Roman blocks (1st century)
‚¨á Byzantine stones (medieval)
‚¨á Ottoman mortar (17th century)

Three empires
One wall
```
**Design Notes:**
- Use arrows or visual indicators to point to actual layers in photo
- Consider annotating photo with lines/labels
- Educational but emotional tone

**Character Count:** 120 characters

---

### Slide 7: The Mystery Tomb
**Visual:** Marble gazebo/tomb with fresh flowers and candles
**Text Overlay:**
```
Fresh flowers
Lit candles
Left today

Legend: Apostle Matthias buried here

But nobody knows for sure
The government won't dig it up

Some mysteries stay mysteries
```
**Design Notes:**
- Reverent, quieter design
- Softer colors (cream, soft gray text)
- Let the flowers/candles be focal point

**Character Count:** 135 characters

---

```
I sat on these walls
for an hour

Thinking about everyone
who stood here before me

Roman legionnaires

We're all just passing through
These stones are the only constant
```

- Darker, moodier color palette

**Character Count:** 178 characters

```
That's nothing

Still standing
```

---

## DESIGN SPECIFICATIONS

**Recommended Tools:**
- **Canva:** Use "Instagram Post" template (1080x1080px)
- **Adobe Express:** Travel/adventure templates
- **Over App:** Layer text over photos with precision
- **Unfold:** Minimalist story-style templates

**Color Palette (derived from fortress environment):**
- **Primary:** Warm stone beige (#D4C4B0)
- **Secondary:** Soft terracotta (#C17B5C)
- **Accent:** Deep sea blue (#2C5F77)
- **Text:** Cream white (#F5F2ED) or deep charcoal (#2B2B2B)
- **Overlay:** Black at 25-35% opacity (for text readability)

**Typography:**
- **Headline font:** Montserrat Bold or Bebas Neue (bold, clean, sans-serif)
- **Body font:** Open Sans, Lato, or Proxima Nova (readable, modern)
- **Headline size:** 64-80pt
- **Body size:** 36-48pt
- **Line height:** 1.3-1.5 (breathing room between lines)

**Layout Guidelines:**
- **Margins:** 8-10% from all edges (safe zone)
- **Text placement:** Avoid dead center (obscures focal point)
  - Top third: For headlines/hooks
  - Bottom third: For reflections/insights
  - Left/right third: For narrative content
- **Photo overlay:** Use gradient overlays (dark at bottom fading to transparent) for bottom-placed text
- **Consistency:** Same font pairing across all 10 slides
- **Visual variety:** Alternate text placement (top, bottom, left, right) to avoid monotony

**Special Design Considerations:**
- **Slide 1:** Biggest, boldest text‚Äîthis is the thumbnail
- **Slide 6:** Consider annotation/diagram style to show wall layers
- **Slide 8:** Most intimate, emotional design‚Äîlet image breathe
- **Slide 10:** Most informational‚Äîclear hierarchy (location ‚Üí cost ‚Üí CTA)

---

## VISUAL STRATEGY

**Photo/Video Selection from Script Timeline:**

1. **Slide 1:** Fortress towers from exterior, dramatic angle (Act 1, arrival footage)
2. **Slide 2:** View from marshrutka or juxtaposition of Soviet buildings + fortress (Act 1)
3. **Slide 3:** Close-up of massive Roman blocks showing texture and scale (Act 2)
4. **Slide 4:** Interior stone staircase or hand touching wall (Act 2, climbing sequence)
5. **Slide 5:** Panoramic view from tower top‚ÄîBlack Sea + mountains (Act 2, top of tower)
6. **Slide 6:** Wall layers close-up showing three construction periods (Act 2, wall detail)
7. **Slide 7:** Marble tomb with fresh flowers and candles (Act 2, mystery tomb)
8. **Slide 8:** Lilia on wall, contemplative or close-up of hand/stone connection (Act 3, reflection)
9. **Slide 9:** Wide dramatic shot showing full fortress scale (Act 3, emotional peak)
10. **Slide 10:** Sunset silhouette or final atmospheric shot (Outro, closing)

**If Missing Specific Visuals:**
- **Pexels/Unsplash search terms:**
  - "Ancient stone fortress texture"
  - "Roman ruins sunset"
  - "Hand touching old stone wall"
  - "Black Sea Georgia coastline"
  - "Byzantine architecture detail"
  - "Historical site contemplation"

**Visual Tone Consistency:**
- Warm color grading (golden hour, earthy tones)
- Emphasis on texture and detail (weathered stone, worn steps)
- Mix of wide/epic and intimate/close-up shots
- Natural lighting preferred (no harsh flash)
- Atmospheric (mist, sunset, dramatic clouds enhance mood)

---

## POSTING TIPS

**Caption:** See `instagram-caption.md` for full caption to accompany this carousel

**Best Practices:**
- **Post timing:**
  - Primary: 7-9 AM EST (morning scroll, high engagement window)
  - Backup: 5-7 PM EST (evening commute/wind-down time)
- **First slide = EVERYTHING:** People decide to swipe in <1 second
  - Must be visually striking
  - Text must create curiosity ("Just Old Stones" + "(That's what I thought)" = immediate contradiction = swipe)
- **Slides 8-10 = Algorithm gold:** Instagram prioritizes carousels that get full completion
  - Save emotional climax for Slide 8 (people who make it here are invested)
  - Slide 9 = payoff/insight (reward for swiping through)
  - Slide 10 = practical value + CTA (maximizes saves)

**Engagement Hacks:**
- **Pin top comment immediately after posting:** "This place broke something open in me. Have you ever been somewhere that put your entire life in perspective?"
- **Add location tag:** Tag "Gonio Fortress" (helps with local discovery)
- **Share to Stories 30 min after posting:** Reshare Slide 1 with poll sticker: "Have you heard of Gonio Fortress? ü§î Yes / No"
- **Respond to first 5 comments within 10 minutes:** Algorithm boost for early engagement

**Avoid:**
- ‚ùå Posting during dead zones (2-4 AM, 11 AM-1 PM when people are busy)
- ‚ùå All slides looking identical (visual monotony kills completion rate)
- ‚ùå Too much text per slide (people won't read walls of text‚Äîaim for 15-20 words max per slide)
- ‚ùå Weak Slide 1 (no second chance to make first impression)

---

## A/B TEST VARIATIONS

Consider testing these alternate approaches on future carousels:

### Test 1: Text Density
- **Version A (Current):** 15-20 words per slide, balanced with image
- **Version B:** Minimal text (5-7 words), let images dominate
- **Track:** Which gets higher completion rate and saves

### Test 2: Slide 1 Hook Variations
- **Version A (Current):** "Just Old Stones / (That's what I thought)"
- **Version B:** "2000 Years Old / And you can touch it"
- **Version C:** "Romans in Georgia? / Yeah, I didn't know either"
- **Track:** Which gets higher swipe-through rate (compare impressions Slide 1 vs Slide 2)

### Test 3: Color Scheme
- **Version A (Current):** Warm/earthy (beige, terracotta, cream)
- **Version B:** Cool/dramatic (deep blues, grays, high contrast)
- **Track:** Which aesthetic drives more saves (indicates perceived value)

### Test 4: CTA Placement
- **Version A (Current):** CTA in Slide 10 + caption
- **Version B:** CTA in caption only, Slide 10 = pure reflection
- **Track:** Which drives more link clicks

**How to Track:**
- Instagram Insights ‚Üí Carousel metrics
- Check "Forward" taps (Slide 1‚Üí2‚Üí3...) vs "Back" taps
- High "Forward" taps = strong hook, good content flow
- High "Back" taps = something confused or lost them
- **Goal:** 60%+ reach Slide 10, 30%+ save the post

---

## SUCCESS METRICS

**Primary KPIs:**
1. **Saves:** Target 8-12% save rate (indicates evergreen value‚Äîpeople want to reference later)
2. **Carousel completion rate:** Target 60%+ reach Slide 10 (strong narrative pull)
3. **Shares:** Target 2-4% share rate (indicates emotional resonance‚Äîpeople want to show friends)

**Secondary KPIs:**
4. **Comments:** Target 100+ thoughtful comments (not just emojis‚Äîpeople sharing their own stories)
5. **Reach:** Target 150%+ of follower count (indicates Explore page pickup)
6. **Profile visits:** Target 5-8% (indicates "who is this person?" curiosity)

**Engagement Quality Indicators (more important than vanity metrics):**
- ‚úÖ Comments sharing personal experiences at historical sites
- ‚úÖ Questions about travel to Georgia
- ‚úÖ Emotional reactions ("This gave me chills", "I'm crying", etc.)
- ‚úÖ Tags to friends ("We HAVE to go here")
- ‚úÖ Debate/discussion in comments (about Romans, history, travel philosophy)

**Red Flags:**
- üö© High drop-off between Slides 1-3 (hook isn't working)
- üö© Comments are all emojis/generic ("Beautiful!", "üòç") = superficial engagement
- üö© Low saves despite high likes = entertaining but not valuable
- üö© No profile visits = content didn't make them curious about YOU

---

## BONUS: INSTAGRAM STORIES CROSS-PROMOTION STRATEGY

**24 Hours After Posting Carousel:**

**Story Frame 1:**
- Reshare carousel post to story
- Add text sticker: "This place changed me"
- Poll sticker: "Have you heard of Gonio Fortress?" (Yes/No)

**Story Frame 2:**
- Behind-the-scenes photo of you at fortress (different angle from carousel)
- Text: "I sat on these walls for an hour trying to process 2000 years of history"
- Question sticker: "What's a place that made you feel this way?"

**Story Frame 3:**
- Screenshot of most emotional comment from carousel
- Text: "THIS. This is why I share these stories ü•π"
- "Share this Story" sticker to encourage spread

**Story Frame 4:**
- Quick video clip (15 sec) from fortress
- Text: "The full story is even more emotional‚Äîlink in bio"
- Link sticker to YouTube video

**Goal of Stories Cross-Promo:**
- Drive second wave of engagement to carousel (24-48 hours post)
- Harvest user-generated content (answers to question sticker)
- Build community through shared experiences
- Drive traffic to full video
